revised_title: Pulse Broadening in Multipath Propagation: A Comparison of Diffraction and Stochastic Ray-Path Theories
tldr: The article compares the diffraction theory and stochastic ray-path analysis to understand pulse broadening due to multipath propagation in radio signals. The author finds that both theories yield the same results, indicating that the stochastic ray-path approach is valid for all values of the coefficient of total scattering, not just in the regime of extreme multiple scattering.
